text: “I hate it. I absolutely hate it. That’s my feedback. Bye.”
“Yes, there is a logic. I’m a designer, not an artist, so I use rationale.”
“It’s all about failure. You can’t get something perfect. There’s no such thing.”
“I’ll tell you one thing—no one else can do it.”
“Anything ugly, if you’ve got a lot of it, is great.”
“Purity doesn’t mean boring.”
“I want to win jobs, I don’t want to win people.”
“It’s not about being right. It’s about being clear and crisp.”
“When you say you’re sophisticated, that means you’re not.”
“Our goal is to make it as good as possible for as little as possible.”
“Dumb and simple is what I specialize in—I’m a graphic designer.”
“Do you want us to be shleppers or do you want us to be helpers?”
“I get it. I just haven’t found a way to portray it.”
“This is hard. It’s not just picking a typeface. It’s picking a methodology, a system.”
“The best work comes out of a crazy accident. If you know everything, you won’t have accidents.”
“One thing you don’t want to do is push something back and then focus on that.”
“Great concept. Too ornamental.”
“If someone comes to me desperately saying ‘I need a logo’ I’m happy to say, ‘no you don’t.” “I don’t give people haircuts if they don’t need them.”
“I want my friends to be smart and funny; I want my products to be smart and funny; I want my work to be smart and funny.”
“There’s nothing like ignorance to make a great job. That’s when I do my best work.”
“We do it because it’s fun and we believe in the concept.”
“I can’t say success is guaranteed; I can’t say all hope is lost.”
“The discovery is the best part.”
“It doesn’t need a fancy typeface.”
“We try everyday to be nice.”
“Remember, our job is to realize his vision.”
“Make sure you don’t upset anybody.”
“If you’re gonna do it, you’re gonna do it the whole way or you don’t do it at all.”
“That’s just not good enough actually.”
“Even if we’re not specifically hired to do strategy, everything we do is strategic.”
“I just don’t think execution should drive the process.”
“Always use your eye.”
“You have the idea, now make it work.”
“It’s too late to terminate it. They’ve baptized the baby in public with the governor present.”
“We only need time for one meeting.”
“I don’t want to do things that don’t exist because I think that’s stupid.”
“You don’t come to us because you want a design, you come to us because you want a quality design that will get finished.”
“Trust me, if you like what you do, you keep on doing it.”
“No, its not ridiculous, it’s important.”
“They say one thing and mean another. Their name is client.”
“We’re high end and scrappy at the same time.”
“There’s not a right or wrong thing to do. Fall in love with something and make it consistently.”
“It’s not about creating stuff. It’s about thinking about what you create.”
“You can’t give someone something that is half done. You just can’t.”
“I care about the dynamic approach, not the static approach.”
“There’s no reason for me to do more work if I’m not going to get paid. What part of that is so complicated?”
“These quotes are not just quotes. They’re voices. Voices that need to be heard.”
“As usual everything is asap.”
“You don’t know what you don’t know and that’s okay.”
“Pay us. Then we’ll show you shit.”
“When I say something’s not gonna work, it normally doesn’t work.”
“I want to be the designer, not the business person.”
“To make it work you need some kind of emotional connection to it.”
“Design should never take six months. It should take two weeks.”
“Think dynamically. Don’t think in print.”
“If all we cared about was function then we’d all be wearing inexpensive black jumpsuits and eating pills to survive.”
“Design gives us variety and pleasure.”
“This isn’t just some crazy doodle we closed our eyes and scribbled down.”
“Something has to be most important.”
“Any tentative move throws you back. It can’t look tentative. It has to look like a deliberate thing.”
“You can’t make an unfamous person famous by an extra paragraph of type. You can only make the type look desirable.”
“This is something I know more about than you.”
“Color is a subjective point of view.”
“Identities, if they’re done well, should be a little bizarre at first.”
“You have ten pounds of shit in a five pound bag.”
“You come up with more ideas than you need in hopes that one will be approved and then you never have to think about it again.”
“You won’t make it work or you would have done it already.”
“You’re making me do unnecessary work. You’re taking my power. Don’t do that.”
“We’re in a period of flux and we’ll get it half right this time and all right the next time.”
“I’m a sunny kind of guy and think everything is okay. It’s called denial by the way.”
“I really can’t continue to work with you if you don’t follow my advice. It’s going to be embarrassing.”
“It’s their building. If they want to make it upside down and purple then we have to make it upside down and purple.”
“I’m not doing that. I’m not doing any of this weird shit.”
“I need this book because I’m running out of talent and I have to steal.”
“Authenticity always wins.”
“It’s hard because everyone feels like they can do it and honestly, everyone can’t.”
“Not knowing the answer is scary.”
“We’ve got no offices, no privacy, no human dignity.”
